title.narrative: 1.5 CP-QUALITY CARE & SOCIAL WELFARE SER

description.narrative: CP : By 2017 access to quality care and social welfare services is improved in underserved areas to prevent, protect and respond to violence, abuse, exploitation and injuries of women and children, as well as family separation due to violence, neglect and disaster, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017 improved quality social services are available and utilized, so disparities and inequalities are reduced in Health, HIV AIDS, Nutrition, Water Sanitation, Education & Child protection
